website_summaries.verdict: Though it's a perfectly fine entry-level camera, there are better options for the money than the Canon EOS Rebel T3.
pros: Unsurprisingly, the Canon EOS Rebel T3 delivers excellent photo quality
cons: Average performance, a nothing-but-the-basics feature set and claustrophobic viewfinder leave the camera an uninspiring shooter

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tested this product out but I just got it in the mail! It is more than I expected. It came with a neck strap, charger, battery and USB cable all for 229$ from TEXTBOOKRUSH! NO this is not sponsored and Im not getting paid for this opinion. Although I was expecting a T3i not a T3... but that's my fault for not reading the name correctly. Other than that Im happy with this product! IT DOESNT COME WITH A MEMORY CARD. Oh and I just ordered this 5 days ago and it barely came in the mail!
customer_reviews.author: Clemencia

customer_reviews.title: The auto focus is hard to work with
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes nice enough pictures once you can get the auto focus to get through its gyrations of back and forth and making sounds. It also just flat out refuses to take pictures in low light, even with the flash set to on. I am beginning to wonder if I have a defective camera. I can't take a picture of a shot that might move like an animal or a child because by the autofocus gets done with all its gyrations, my subject has moved and I have lost the shot. Really frustrating! I have tried taking it off the auto focus but then the pictures are blurry because there really isn't a way to focus through the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Still learning how to use it...
customer_reviews.text: ... but I LOVE it so far! I had always been happy with the quality of my iPhone photos (I haven't used my Canon point & shoot in years) until I bought this. I take a photo of the same subject with each, and the difference in quality is amazing. The only complaint I have (and it doesn't even bother me enough to reduce my rating) is that the shutter is slower when I have the display screen on. I use this mainly for food photography, so if I'm taking a picture of a cake it's no big deal. But if I'm photographing a moving, breathing subject I turn the screen off and use the viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great starter camera
customer_reviews.text: To start, I am an amateur at photography. I have been using cameras on and off for years, my first was a 32mm that belonged to my parents. I prefer the quality of the photos that SLRs make as opposed to the point-n-clicks. That said, to the camera. The build is quite solid, but I don't recommend dropping it. I did set it down a little rough and it was fine. The quality of the pictures is perfect for me. The lens it comes with is perfect for portraits and I wouldn't recommend it for anything else. The flash is quite good, but I rarely use it as my hand is steady enough for some fantastic pictures without the light.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Timko

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: We ADORE this camera. We originally purchased a Nikon after being told that Nikon was the best. Not so. We were taking better quality pictures with our iPhones. It was basically a high priced point and shoot. We promptly returned it and purchased the Canon EOS Rebel T3 and could not be more thrilled. Many of the pictures we've taken with this camera have been put on canvas in our home and people always ask us who our professional photographer is! We simply adore this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Good dlsr starter camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because all the reviews were so good and I had been lusting after a DSLR for a few years. I've had it for a few months and I'm still learning all of the features. It's confusing to me because it's my first dslr. I'm also taking a photo. class with it and learning how to edit pictures in photoshop and cs6 using RAW which has been great. The speed with which I'm learning the camera, photo techniques and editing is upped thanks to a knowledgable teacher. The shots are clear and beautiful. The camera isn't too heavy but feels sturdy enough. The lens is easy enough to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Love this Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. I would definitely recommend it for anyone who is serious about photography. If you don't know much about photography, aperture, shutter speed, etc, this is too much camera for you. You'll just end up spending a lot more money to use the same "auto" feature that you would be using on a less expensive camera. However, if you are a photographer or aspiring to be, this is a great camera with a lot of cool features.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It is (obviously) bulky so it is often not very convenient to take on outings, but I have been able to take good family photos worthy of being enlarged and framed in place of purchasing expensive packages from a photographer (though I know they do better work than I do). I owned the 35mm version before I purchased this one. I still love the Canon Rebel. It's a great camera for the amateur photographer who wants to do a little more than point and shoot, but doesn't have all of the know-how for more complex cameras.
customer_reviews.author: L Karr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have been into photography for many years, and still use old manual SLRs such as Minolta and Canon, but wanted something that wouldn't break the bank in digital and still be able to take wonderful photos as well as do astrophotography... this camera fits that bill perfectly! Keep in mind that it's cropped sensor camera, so the exposure plane of the sensor is a little smaller than a full sensor frame camera, which translates that your lens selection will show a little differently, but it also means that you have a wide range of lenses and great features! And with image stabilization lenses available, I take macro photos all day long without a tripod and they turn out perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Aeryck S. De Sade

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal?!?! (although maybe not for full-time professionals)
customer_reviews.text: If you're average Joe - Amateur status, this is the perfect DSLR for you. I'm sure that professionals would trash it, and talk about how cheap the lens is, but this camera does EVERYTHING I need it for and more. I would have never guessed I could get a DSLR this nice for $335. Judging by the pictures/results I have gotten with this thing I'd think it was a $800-$1000 camera. I highly recommend this, and I'm glad I didn't waste hundreds of dollars buying a more expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: Insomniac

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're not a bells-and-whistles type of person.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I had been looking at the T2i or T3i for a while, but couldn't afford them. It took a while to even save up enough (thanks to generous gifts from several family members and friends) to even afford this one. But once I got it, I realized that I love it! I use the different settings for monotone, cooler or warmer, etc., and when the auto settings aren't working well, I manually adjust the shutter speed and aperture. But I use the viewfinder more than the screen anyway, and I've realized that I really didn't need all the extra bells and whistles of the -i cameras. This one works great!
customer_reviews.author: KayGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: All of my past cameras were point and shoot but I wanted a camera that took a better picture. This is a great transitional camera if you're not familiar and not a professional. The user book is easy to read and follow. Pictures are beautiful. Light weight and not as much of a burden as I thought it would be to carry around. I read many other reviews from people that sounded like they knew what they were talking about, which really helped. But this is a post for those that aren't photography/camera savvy but just want a great picture. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: momma3

customer_reviews.title: Canon Rebel T3
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I have had this for a few months now and couldn't be happier. I wanted a dslr just for fun beginning photography for fun and for capturing clear shots of my speedy little boy. I was so pleased to find the Canon Rebel T3 for such a great price. It takes great photos and I have had a lot of fun figuring out all of the features and learning how to capture those great shots. Part of me wishes I would have sprung for the T3i, but I think this is a great beginning dslr and I have taken so many shots that I am so happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great camera! Like many devices
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Like many devices, added features means more complexity. Therefore there are features that I have not used yet. I am very impressed with the ability of the camera to compensate for my bad hand tremors.The photos come out quite clear. For those who want a camera that is NOT a telephone and that you can grow into, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Canon Digital Rebel T3
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for Astro photography and regular photography. Much more sensitive to low light than my Olympus E-410 and less noise at low light conditions. Auto mode works well indoors but in lower light conditions it pops the flash up and washes out the background. Landscape works better at twilight conditions. Battery life seems to be good, but am ordering a 2000mah battery for a spare. Shutter speed only goes down to 30" but with Aputure Timer Camera Remote Control Shutter that is no problem. Recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: D. Irving

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter camera
customer_reviews.text: When I got this camera I was a complete n00b to photography. However, this camera is very intuitive (I thought I was going to have to read the manual, but instead I just started using it and haven't had any questions yet). I love that you can use it in full manual mode, or fully automatic mode. It has excellent image processing, and I really like that it can save pictures in RAW format. The aesthetics aren't something to write home about, but for this kind of a price you can't expect everything to be perfect. As a hobbyist, I think this camera is going to last me a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Even a novice can take a great photo
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2-year old son (who is the center of all photo activity at our house) that was impossible to catch in the moment with my old camera. Now that I have this one we capture everything. The manual was pretty straight forward and after a few test shots I figured out the best settings for the moment (inside/outside/active/etc). Loving this camera. If you are a novice but hoping to capture special moments this may be the camera. It is a little bulkier than what I am used to, but that doesn't matter. Great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: FCB

customer_reviews.title: Great camera; multiple features
customer_reviews.text: This camera is so feature-rich that I'm still learning all the auto and manual adjustments that enhance the photographic experience.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter camera
customer_reviews.text: I read DPReview.com reviews and saw test photos (as compared to other cameras). This one looked great for its price (low noise, good sharpness with stock lens, etc). My dad uses it now: he started off knowing nothing about digital photography other than "high resolution"; and he's doing great! This camera is easy to use - simple to switch to timer setting for tripod selfies. My brother has professional canon cameras and this one compares nicely - it even does excellent video shooting :)
customer_reviews.author: Boris Yakubchik

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good camera. Plenty of features with reasonably good ergonomics. I would prefer to have a dedicated depth of field preview button instead of having to assign the function to the select button on the back of the camera. When wearing gloves, it's easy to hit one of the settings buttons that surround the select button. The kit lens has good performance, but is frustrating to use for precise manual focusing. There's just too much slop in the focus ring.
customer_reviews.author: Supreme Commander

customer_reviews.title: amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: i have a 18 month toddler who is always on the go. i was getting frustrated with missing all the great pix with my point and shoot and had been wanting a SLR camera bc i had heard such great things about them. After reading many reviews online i finally decided to go for the canon rebel t3, and so far i could not be happier. it is very easy to use for a beginner and the pix have come out amazing! From action shots, to close ups very clear, crisp beautiful shots. i am really so happy with this purchase and highly recommend it-especially if you have very active kids.
customer_reviews.author: emk915

customer_reviews.title: Right camera, right features, right price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use in 'point and shoot' mode or but also provides creative options. As much camera as I need--more complicated options and a higher price would be a waste for me. As an artist I want to focus on my own work, not become a pro photographer. I need to take pictures for reference to paint later, take candid shots at openings for use in publicity and blogs, document my work for inventory purposes and have high quality images for submission to shows and galleries. This camera fills the bill!
customer_reviews.author: L. Brannel

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a DSLR and bought this camera after not having used an SLR for many years (previously used a similar film Canon -- step down from the Rebel -- in photography class in 2003). Although I still need to refresh my knowledge and skills, so far, I'm very happy with this camera. It takes great pictures, and holds up to my slightly rough use (I'm pretty clumsy and bump it into things frequently when I carry it around my neck). I think the controls and menus could be more intuitive and easy to use, but maybe that will get better as I use the camera more.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great Results and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have used Point and Shoot Cameras my entire life. I was intimidated about taking the next step to Digital SLR. I received this camera in the mail and i was able to use it an hour later for a photo shoot. It has exceeded my expectations in terms of picture quality and the speed, which is incredible. There are so many options on this camera that every situation of photography is present. I will never go back to point and shoots after having this camera, although i would recommend buying another lens for long range shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and shipped very quickly
customer_reviews.text: The item was exactly as described, came very well packaged and everything is in excellent condition! They shipped the item out very promptly and I am overall very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P

customer_reviews.title: Substantial DSLR for less than $400
customer_reviews.text: I have just received this camera. My first impression is that it takes beautiful pictures. I mainly use it in the office, and take pictures indoors. The colours are vivid and clear. Focusing is somewhat slow and tedious. Once it decides to focus, then it holds the picture and you don't get movement artefact. With my older 7 year old sony the focusing was a problem and often the photos were out of focus. I will post any negatives if I come across it. I give it 5 stars on initial impression. Hopefully i don't have to change my mind.
customer_reviews.author: 68cuffs

customer_reviews.title: No owners manual
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price and the fast service. It only took a few weeks for delivery! I think I love you and the product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Ruskovich

customer_reviews.title: Best deal for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I do stop motion animation but I also like taking pictures. This isn't a pro camera but it comes pretty darn close sometimes! The images are really good. I always use the manual setting because I'm a control freak and don't like my camera to think for me. It's nice and light. I've used it for everything from family snapshots to somewhat artistic photos to animation. Right now it's attached to a tripod looking at a light box for paint on glass animating and it does a perfect job.
customer_reviews.author: Orange Illusions

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good camera for taking close up pictures of jewelry. Anyone who has every photographed jewelry knows what a complete pain it is. I had the right lighting system, and now I have the right camera to take the pictures. The 55 MM lens is perfect for close up shots and being able to adjust the shutter speed, ISO and aperture were vital to the success of my jewelry photography. I didn't know much about cameras until I bought this one, and I'm glad I did. It was recommended to me from another jewelry photographer. I recommend this camera to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Greg T

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with this camera~!
customer_reviews.text: This camera's been EXCELLENT! I'm not super pro at photography, but you would never know by the pictures! As a beginner, the camera was not difficult to figure out. (The internet was very helpful along with the manual) The picture quality is WONDERFUL. I have owned it for about a week now and have taken it everywhere. I've heard complaints about the battery, however, I've found the battery to last quite a while. (Takes about 700 shots per battery, good enough for me.) It is totally worth the money and I would recommend it in a heartbeat! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for all around use. It takes great pictures and has all of the versatility most users would ever want. Although bigger than the camera it replaced, it's size or weight has never been in issue for us. I prefer it to the smaller camera's because of its versatility and because its battery lasts much longer. It also can take multiple flash pictures very quickly so you don't miss things waiting for the camera to recycle.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Lots of features, great video
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for about a month, so it's a little early to make a definite assessment. But so far I really enjoy it. It has a lot of features that I'm still learning. The auto mode is typically pretty good for most photos, but you'll have to play with the settings on "Creative Auto" for best pictures under low light. The video quality is very good, though again don't trust the auto settings and determine the best lighting conditions for yourself. I haven't played with the software a lot but it seems pretty powerful to edit photos.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Schindler

customer_reviews.title: Must have for families with kids!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera that would literally allow me to capture "a moment in time". I purchased it when my baby was 2 months old, frustrated with my small digital camera that would get the picture AFTER our baby quit smiling. We have owned this camera for over 2 months and it has not let us down! The shutter speed is very quick, and you can take multiple pictures quickly. It's durable, lightweight, and takes excellent pictures. Best yet, the price is very competitive--not to mention the money we've saved by not having to hire a professional photographer each month!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using an old point & shoot camera for a number of years, and it was starting to act its age :) I decided that I wanted something "more" for my next camera. A few fellow baseball parents had a similar camera and I decided to give it a try. I love it! I still haven't had time to read the manual & figure out how it all works, but so far, so good! I definitely would like to purchase an additional lens for better zooming capabilities, but this is fine for now.
customer_reviews.author: L. Romanic

customer_reviews.title: Really nice camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for almost a year now and I have to say it's a really nice camera. It's the only DSLR I've ever owned, so I can't compare it to others, but it really does what I want it to. It's easy to switch to manual and set up a perfect shot exactly how I want it to look. I've recently got into the HDR aspect of photography, and it's easy to do with this camera. You can set the camera to take 3 consecutive shots at different exposures, then import into Photoshop's HDR feature, and it lets you tweak it to get the look you want.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.text: It's a work horse and I love it. I bought it as my Sony Nex C-3 was starting to go downhill after 3 years of working it beyond it's limit. This camera was a massive upgrade for me and really get's the job done. I love the beautiful results and ease of use. I still find new things out when I play with it. The only thing I wish is that it had a higher ISO setting like some of the models just above it. If that were the case I would never need another camera ever again because this does everything I want and more!
customer_reviews.author: White

customer_reviews.title: Really like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a simple point and shoot. Really like this camera. I do a lot of photography at races, air shows and some astrophotography. Found this camera meets all those demands. Battery life is great as well. I can easily make it through day long events, taking thousands of photos on a single charge. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: B. Karczewski

customer_reviews.title: Nice step up from the world of totally automated point-and-shoot cameras
customer_reviews.text: I'm learning a lot about camera optics from this camera, which allows the user to experiment with different settings fairly freely while still providing a fully automated mode - in fact, several such modes - that produce fine results. I'm sure there are comparable and even better values in other Canon models and similar cameras from other manufacturers, but I'm not equipped to do the comparison and evaluation. I'm happy with the money paid for this model, and am investing leftover cash in additional lenses, etc. rather than buying a competitive camera for the sake of comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Dale A. Hunscher

customer_reviews.title: scam
customer_reviews.text: scam i bought this in 2013 and only to get a used broken camera that was covered in dirt you’ll lose ur money do NOT even bother and buy from best buy
customer_reviews.author: Mell

customer_reviews.title: Auto Focus works great for amatuer giving professional photos
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for even an amatuer to use - I previously used just a simple digital camera but needed higher resolution for my stock photos for reselling on Amazon. I just use the autosettings on this camera WITHOUT a tripod and the photos come out fabulous without blur. The hand shake feature works great for this middle-aged lady. THRILLED.
customer_reviews.author: Camo Chique

customer_reviews.title: awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Don't be fooled by some of the reviews, there is a learning curve to using this camera. Once you get through some tutorial videos on you tube, you can start playing with the camera. I realized that it is the photographer not the camera who can take beautiful pics. I took it on vacation with me. Even though I used the programmed functions, not the manual settings, the pics were much better than with my Sony Powershot. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: ulas

customer_reviews.title: Get the T4 or better
customer_reviews.text: This is great for a beginner. My biggest complain is that when it is in video mode, it does not autofocus. You have to put the button to focus periodically. The other thing I didn't consider until I purchased it was the lack of a front screen. Some of the newer models have a screen you can flip around like a camcorder does. If you are a YouTuber or like to film yourself, this is not a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: CatMom

customer_reviews.title: Best first DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I had a small problem but they helped me fix it (operator error), they got back to me in just a few minutes and ten minutes later I was good to go. This is a great camera for some one getting a digital SLR for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Love my T3
customer_reviews.text: I love my T3. It's a great starter camera and 12 megapixels is all you really need. The lens options are limitless with this camera. Pros: Easy to use. Stable. Lots of lens options. "Well most SLR cameras the lens options are good" The manual is easy to read and Canon stands by their lenses and camera. The battery life is awesome. Went to Canada on vacation for a week and after 400 pictures I came home with over 80% of a charge. NO recharging needed. Cons: My camera only came with one lens. I have noticed some cameras with two starter lenses for the price I paid. Still I give this camera 5 stars for the quality. :)
customer_reviews.author: Yak

customer_reviews.title: The camera was easy to use if you are just a point and ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera for my 9th grade daughter so she could use it for a photography class. The camera was easy to use if you are just a point and shoot kind of user, and the option to grow in your photography skills is made simple using the camera. The user guide and a little practice made our daughter our family photographer. It is versatile, and I like the fact that you can buy extra lenses to attach.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Camera takes great pictures but died after 2 years of infrequent use
customer_reviews.text: This camera was great but died after 2 years of minimal usage. This camera was $500 when I bought it, and I think for that price an item should last longer than 2 years. The cameras memory became corrupted and Canon said they would fix it for $200. Not much less than buying the camera body new. I still have my 1st Canon 35 millimeter from the 70's and it works great. It's too bad that things are not made to last anymore. I may switch to Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: momitch

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fine camera. I love my little cupcake. Quality is wonderful! I am a costume model, sometimes I take selfies a lot. This camera is the ​best fit for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Hyeon-I Son

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I own a Nikon D60 and bought this as a gift for my mom. Was a bit suspicious of it since it's not the "i" series and when I took it out of the box it was a bit plastic-y. However, after playing around with it - it takes AMAZING pictures! And has high-quality video that you can manipulate with the zoom and manual focus. I hope to be able to purchase one for myself soon and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for their first (or second!) DSLR camera.
customer_reviews.author: thewisegirlwins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I decided to get this as she wanted to learn photography. This thing works great and is easy for her to use as a beginner. The photos come out beautifully just using the auto setting and it is easy to transfer everything over to a computer. The battery lasts for days and days so we only have to charge it every once in a while. We have been using this for roughly 3 months now and have yet to run into an issue. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew LaClair

customer_reviews.title: and it was FAR better than any of the point-and-shoot alternatives
customer_reviews.text: I have never used any other DSLR, so I don't know how this one compares to others, but it was (relatively) cheap, and it was FAR better than any of the point-and-shoot alternatives. I had given up on cheap cameras and started taking pictures with my phone, but I take this one with me whenever I actually expect to take pictures of anything. It is worth carrying an extra bag.
customer_reviews.author: Retorque

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 13 year old daughter as her first "real" camera. I have a more high end albeit older Canon camera. I am amazed at the quality of the pictures this camera takes! Better than mine! It is user friendly and, of course, the lenses can be inter changed with other Canon lenses when she gets up to spped on usage. After doing some research, I determined that Amazon had the best price around Overall, I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Love my camera
customer_reviews.text: Love my camera. Great for beginners wanting to take more advanced photos. Comes with a lens that is great for close up photos of people. It is also takes great photos of scenery. You would just need to purchase a different lens to "zoom in" on objects that are not close up.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel

customer_reviews.title: Best entry camera I've used.
customer_reviews.text: I have upgraded to a 60 D. I look back and realize what fantastic images this camera shot!
customer_reviews.author: Beekie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic DSLR Camera for Amateurs!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic starter camera! I've wanted this camera forever and although I took forever to buy it, I'm very happy with the purchase. They now have a T3i model (which is is compatible with a wireless remote), but the T3 serves its purpose and has the same quality. I'm going to be a picture-taking, Instagraming fool now!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter camera
customer_reviews.text: Perfect starter camera. Takes a great picture and is a great introduction to taking manual photos. Even if you get a better model later this one is nice to have when you are going somewhere that might be a little rougher on the more expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Murdock

customer_reviews.title: it came in nearly perfect shape. The battery that came with it holds ...
customer_reviews.text: Although used, it came in nearly perfect shape. The battery that came with it holds a charge really well and I am enjoying using it. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Canon Fan
customer_reviews.text: I love my old Canon SLR so had a hard time making the decision to "go digital" - but feel like it was necessary in today's world. This camera was offered at a great price and had good ratings. I am so happy with my purchase. Love the camera - and love that I have the option to do everything automatically or manually depending on situation. I am also amazed at how much lighter this camera is than my old (but still awesome) Canon EOS Rebel SLR. The digital is really convenient - and the photos quality is excellent. I am a satisfied customer!
customer_reviews.author: CSP

customer_reviews.title: Still can't believe how awesome this camera is!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this is the best deal! I priced this same camera, same specs, with Target, Walmart, BestBuy, Canon's website, Sears...etc. Buying through Amazon (Prime) probably saved me over $150.00. I have now had this for over 6 months. I have had NO issues. The quality of the pictures are pristine! This makes photography fun! Its good for beginners. Its good for veterans. You can't go wrong, and its easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: tcgonda

customer_reviews.title: I love my camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE almost everything about this camera. The only complaint is that sometimes I would prefer that it snap pictures faster on the regular settings, but most times that is not a problem. It does move fast if you are set on the action setting which is good. I have pictures from many beautiful places on this camera and they almost always turn out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JBen

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners! I highly recommend it. Good image quality, tons of settings to play with. If you're into learning how to work with cameras, this should be your first. The video is ok, but not something so wow. I just think is something the guys at Canon placed in the camera as a bonus. Nothing too fancy. If you want a camera with good video quality maybe you should look for a little higher price.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Sweet camera
customer_reviews.text: Even though it is a much better camera than the one I own, I purchased this for my 20 year old son, as a combination holiday and birthday present. I'm not sure who was more delighted; him, playing with it and shooting pictures for days on end, or me just observing his pleasure and joy. Canon rules, that's that.
customer_reviews.author: sassafrass66

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1st DSLR camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to take better quality photos of my twin daughters. It does a great job. There are many functions I still have yet to learn, but the auto mode does great for me as a beginner. I am excited to learn more. This camera is priced well and taking the leap was well worth it! If you are on the fence, this is a great camera that I love using.
customer_reviews.author: kdavis1106

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: I have a T2 rebel and my daughter was very jealous so for her b-day. She loves it. I just went to visit her in Portland and we spent five days taking pictures. The ocean, fireworks, flowers, water falls... It was great and the pictures all turned out great! Not too hard to use, my daughter is a graphic designer and she figured out all the features! Came in two days and was packaged just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: great gift!
customer_reviews.text: got this is a university graduation gift. great camera and easy to maintain. takes wonderful pictures as long as the lighting isn't a total mess. love it for quick family snaps or get togethers. use it for homemade holiday cards for the loved ones - with good photo editing and a fantastic printer no need for "professionals". great gift for the casual photograper in your family.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Camera
customer_reviews.text: As my first DSLR Camera, I don't think I could have made a better purchase. Started taking pictures right out of the box using the automatic settings. Let's you grow at your own pace while still enabeling you to take great pictures. All the dials and buttons a little intimidating at first but once you learn your way around the camera it seems pretty user friendly. Purchased Canon EOS Rebel T3/1100D For Dummies to go along with my learning experience. Instruction booklet that came with the camera a little confusing and not very explanatory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2019 still using it
customer_reviews.text: Brought it 8 year ago. Quality still supber. Larger sensor than best camera phone out there
customer_reviews.author: Smartshopper

customer_reviews.title: My First SLR Cam
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this Camera because I love taking pictures and I love the quality it brings into my life! The picture is so crisp and clean and the settings are fairly easy to understand! It is compatible with several gadgets that I have bought for it such as a detchable speedlight, remote control shutter release, etc.!
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: A very good camera for still pictures
customer_reviews.text: A very good camera for still pictures. However when you take videos, the range of auto focus for video is somehow limited by the previous set focus range. Therefore the video may be blurred if you have focused on some close up before you use the video. If anyone feels that my comments are wrong please let me know. Maybe I do not know how to use the video features of this camera properly.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Takes great pictures
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to produce such great quality photos as these.
customer_reviews.author: Heath Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After searching for a good easy to use camera and reading all other reviews, this one is exactly what I was looking for. I am not a professional photographer, I use it for special family functions and to take pictures of my infant, its easy point shoot is so much fun and worth it! I enjoy trying all the fuctions, easy to read manual, gives plenty of pointers for those who are not professionals.
customer_reviews.author: Denali559

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I gift for my hubby he offer pix so beautiful bring my home I I open check all no broken or scratch good
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Fama

customer_reviews.title: The perfect gift for my husband
customer_reviews.text: He wanted a "really good digital camera", so we checked online and this is the one he chose. An old neighbor of his had one, and he used it a few days to be sure. He loves it, and recently took photos of an event in our town for the local TV station. The photos are clear, it's easy to use, and I might just try it myself. I am not a photographer.....yet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schum

customer_reviews.title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm IS II Lens
customer_reviews.text: My rating is actually more like 4.55 stars. Other than the light weight (which emphasizes shake), this camera is absolutely perfect for both beginners and intermediate photographers (or amatuers who like sharp, luxuriant photos without having to take a 4 year college course to get them!). I've been a lover of great images for over 35 years and am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: this camera has opened up a whole new world of photography, I had a cloudshot scene on my up one my screen, a friend was over and until i told her different, she thought it was a commercial image wall paper. there is a bit of a learning curve, but once you actually start using it, it is great. i got the canon rebel for dummies book and that has bee a great teacher to my camera
customer_reviews.author: skuddle

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Camera
customer_reviews.text: I was a Nikon loyalist for years until purchasing this camera. I have yet to find a single flaw in it. This camera made me switch from film within a week. Easy to learn and contains endless features. Perfect camera for budding professionals or casual enthusiasts looking for a more than capable piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: I love love love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this camera! I've never had a camera this nice, and it's so worth it to be able to take pictures that are clear with little effort. To me it's totally worth the money to be able to take good pictures of my kids. I wish I would have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: lbpjj02468

customer_reviews.title: Takes great pictures and is easy to use, Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I have had a 35mm camera before and several digital camera's. I was disappointed with some of the digital cameras because sometimes they had correct lighting and sometimes they didn't, sometimes they were in focus and sometimes they weren't all were auto focus. I was a little afraid to spend the money on an expensive camera( at least expensive for me),but I'm glad I did. This camera is so easy to use and it takes great pictures. I have taken pictures from a distance and gotten home, zoomed in on a subject in the picture cropped out the rest and the quality of the print was wonderful. Can't complain about anything so far. The price was right also.
customer_reviews.author: tealpond

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap gotten so much use with this
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap gotten so much use with this. Pair it with decent lenses and you can get some truly beautiful pics.
customer_reviews.author: Jonel Shuason

customer_reviews.title: Canon, never disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy all my cameras by Canon so far, and this one is no exception. It performs flawlessly! I really recommend it for starting DSLR photography. 2lbs, not too heavy at all. I am going to use this for my upcoming overseas trip and I cannot wait!
customer_reviews.author: Stark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR, and I'm having a blast with it! Even just keeping it on auto mode takes much better pictures than I used to take. I'm slowly learning all the settings and this camera makes it easy to mess around with.
customer_reviews.author: Vkapadia

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Canon Rebel because it is an easy no-brainer for photography. I love photography, but I'm not at a professional point. Just enough to capture the moments! It's quick and easy to use. Portable. Everything I need! I loved the Canon Rebel when I was in yearbook class, so that's where I found my love for it, and had to have my own. Way better than my digital camera!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: I am just thrilled with this camera. I've had a couple of digital point and shoots and thought I needed the small size they offered. Can't believe what I've been missing. Love everything about this camera. I'm hauling around a diaper bag anyway... might as well use the phone as a phone and use this for stunning pics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal! I bought this as a Christmas gift ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal! I bought this as a Christmas gift for my teenage daughter, who has taken an interest in photography! The camera came with the original box, paperwork, etc. This is the first time I've purchased used goods from Amazon and what a great experience!
customer_reviews.author: Lia Ken

customer_reviews.title: The seller is very good to work with.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Canon Rebel T3 I’ve purchased. My realtor wife has monopolized the first one I purchased so now I have my own. I chose this same camera again because it takes such good quality photos.
customer_reviews.author: Iram Coal Nickel-Copper

customer_reviews.title: Keeps getting better...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR camera. I have shopped and shopped looking for one and even asked friends and professional photographers. The end result is purchasing the Canon T3. I have been slowly trying all the features and I am just amazed of the picture quality and ease of use. This has been a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing instrument for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This camera has more buttons than my computer and is just as difficult to learn to operate. The users manual takes two days to read but it tells almost everything needed to operate the camera. There are still a few functions I don't know how to operate but, I'm learning and it's lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Tinkerer36

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the best value out there. I have some pro friends and their $2000 cameras are noticabyy better than mine, but I am at least in the game for a fraction of the cost. Also, had a small issue after a few times using it and Cannon took care of it no questions asked and almost no $ to me.
customer_reviews.author: gtae04

customer_reviews.title: Super value
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best bang for the buck of any DSLR entry level. Image quality is absolutely excellent, Without all the extra whistles and bells that you get in the much more expensive DSLR's costing $2-$10,000. If you don't need a full frame DSLR this is the way to go; the APS – C sensor is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Caveat Emptor

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera days before our big trip to Yellowstone National Park. I had a Cannon G6 but was looking for a new camera that would take amzazing pictures. Based on other reviews on Amazon I got this camera and it did not dissapoint!! This camera takes incredible pictures and I couln't have picked a better time to upgrade. I have gotten so many compliments on my pictures since purchasing it. Buy this camera, you will be glad you did!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Canon Rebel T3
customer_reviews.text: I was Dying to get this camera, I sent for it on the two day shiping and those were the two longest days for me. when I finally got It,I was like a kid opening his toys on christmas. let me tell you that this camera is awsome, it has all you can imagine, feature wise, I'm glad I chose this as my first profetional camera, Im hoping to learn every single feature
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It will take more practice-but I won't cut off heads in my photos.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get nice photos right away-first attempt to use the camera .The camera took good pics of nighttime in a snowstorm and snow ball fight. The trip was one to take "precious non-replaceable photos" of our 4 yr old grandson and his encounters with Santa's Elf, breakfast with Santa, the wonderful sleigh ride in a one horse open sleigh- plus SNOW !!!
customer_reviews.author: yelrah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been reviewing DSLR's for a couple months now, and as far as bang for the buck goes, this camera does it all. It is a big upgrade from a regular point and shoot and has full range of adjustments. Sure, there are probably better ones out there, but this one does everything you need it to do, and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Jkronetwlv

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this for me as a birthday/christmas present. I really didn't want him spending a lot on something that we had no idea if it would be worth it but it totally is! I use it to take pictures of the kids almost every day to send to him in Afghanistan. It takes amazing shots with such clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Canon camera
customer_reviews.text: Super SLR camera that is very easy to use and creates wonderful pictures. I really dislike trying to use the screen on most compact cameras and this modestly priced camera allows through the lens viewing. I suggest buying an instruction book because the manual is pretty light on the capabilities of this fine camera.
customer_reviews.author: John Calland

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: By far one of the best investments we've ever made. This is our first DSLR camera; prior to this we had the quick pocket-type digital cameras. This camera is very fast (memory card plays a part in this; we have Class 10) and shoots great pictures and video.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my wife - replaced point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with quality and package contents. My wife was able to take photos right out of the box by adding our own sd card. an 8Gb card stores about 60 photos. Menus were easy to follow for setup and use. Printed quality on a canon pixma 3500 printer are excellent. Camera shipped quickly, was packaged well and arrived in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Great camera - but it is the first DSLR I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Rosewill is a good vendor and met my expectations. The camera is a good one: I have used beaten up copies of this same item and it has shown itself to be durable. That is the main reason why I wanted the Rebel T3. It is a shame it is no longer manufactured. Then again, this is the first DSLR I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Kiddo

customer_reviews.title: Canon Rebel T3
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera as a gift for my better half. Price was the best I could find anywhere. It arrived quickly. Apparently it is easy to use (according to my wife). Great intro to DSLR (?). Plus it is a camera she can grow with as she improves. Probably should have bit the bullet and purchased an extra lens but I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: TS Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic introduction into DSLR's
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a piece of work, I've had it about a month and man, let me tell you this thing takes some beautiful pictures. It's easy to figure out without the manual as well. I did replace the stock lens with a "nifty fifty" just because I like the feel of the photos more than any issues from the kit lens.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I had used a few point and shoot cameras before, but I felt like getting into DSLR's. And good thing I chose this camera. Works like a charm. The auto moodes are great for first time photographers, and the manual mode is not as intimidating as other cameras. So if you are just getting into photography, it's a great price and an excellent camera.
customer_reviews.author: P. Goodman

product_meta.title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 Digital SLR Camera with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Lens (discontinued by manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
The Canon 5157B002 includes the EOS Rebel T3 Digital SLR Camera and the EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS type II Lens. This camera and lens is perfect for photographers ready to make the move to digital SLR photography. The EOS Rebel T3 delivers beautiful photos and video, speed, simplicity and fun. It features a 12.2 Megapixel CMOS Image Sensor and Canon DIGIC 4 Image Processor for richly detailed images and quick camera response. It has Canon's amazing 63-zone, dual-layer metering for accurate exposures and features Canon's Basic+ function, HD video recording and Live View shooting, plus a convenient in-camera Feature Guide.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

New Technology for Outstanding Images. 
12.2 Megapixel CMOS (APS-C) sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor for high image quality and speed. 
Canon’s CMOS (Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor) sensor captures images with exceptional clarity and tonal range, and offers the most pixels in its class. It offers many of the same new technologies to maximize each pixel’s light gathering efficiency that were first seen with the professional EOS-1D Mark III model. It’s an APS-C size sensor (22.2 x 14.8mm), and there's an effective 1.6x increase in the lens's marked focal length when attached.

 
12.2 Megapixel APS-C Size CMOS Sensor


DIGIC 4 Image Processor
The improved DIGIC 4 Image Processor ensures that images are captured, processed and saved with remarkable speed. The EOS Rebel T3 DSLR’s new 3:2 multiple aspect ratio, in-camera RAW image processing, creative filters, image resizing and provided S2 and S3 image-recording quality are all possible thanks to the DIGIC 4 Image Processor. With dazzling results, the new DIGIC 4 Image Processor also works to capture and process data of images shot at 12.2 Megapixels at 3.0 fps, as well as 14-bit signal processing for excellent image gradation, enhanced Face Detection Live mode, Full HD video recording, Auto Lighting Optimizer and Lens Peripheral Optimization.




Excellence from Dawn to Dusk.
ISO 100 – 6400 for shooting from bright to dim light. 
With a broad range of ISO settings, the EOS Rebel T3 enables shooting from sunrise to sunset and helps ensure capture of the finest detail. With enhanced high-sensitivity optimization, subjects can be captured clearly and easily at high shutter speeds without flash, with minimized blur and noise. In bright scenes, especially long exposures in daylight, optimal exposure can be achieved with a fully open wide-diameter lens, no dark filter needed.




High Definition Made Easy. 
Improved EOS HD Movie mode with expanded recording [HD: 30p (29.97) / 25p], and with in-camera video editing options. 
The EOS Rebel T3 DSLR’s expanded repertoire of technologies includes shooting video in brilliantly clear, exactingly sharp high definition for playback on your HDTV! Shooting at 1280 x 720 at 30 (29.97) or 25 frames per second, HD video can be taken immediately through the EOS Rebel T3 camera’s intuitive operation and layout. Parameters for white balance and picture style are already set — just grab and go!

Incredible AutoFocus. 
High speed, reliable 9-point AF system utilizing a high precision, f/5.6 cross-type center point. 
The EOS Rebel T3 has a high-precision, 9-point AF system utilizing a high-precision, f/5.6 cross-type center point. The 9-point AF system uses both normal and high-precision focus depending on the aperture and available light. The 9 focus points can be chosen automatically or manually selected.


9-point AF


Accurate Metering for Perfect Exposure. 
Enhanced metering with a 63-zone, Dual-layer metering system for accurate metering between exposures. 
The EOS Rebel T3 features Canon’s newest Dual-layer sensor, with 63 zones. By measuring not only the amount of light, but also taking into account color and luminosity, this new system delivers a very high level of accuracy for better results every time. Since the metering sensor has a color measurement function, exposure errors and focus errors caused by different light sources are minimized; the EOS Rebel T3 gives stable exposure from shot to shot in situations where light changes, such as sports on a cloudy day, or indoor holiday scenes.


Metering zones


Speedy, Precise Operation.
3.0 fps continuous shooting up to approximately 3 JPEGs or approximately 2 RAW.
The EOS Rebel T3 operates with such effortless speed that operation is nothing short of intuitive. With instant startup times, speedy autofocus and minimal shutter lag, the EOS Rebel T3 is one of the fastest cameras available today. It can shoot up to 3.0 fps (frames per second), in bursts of up to approximately 3 JPEGs or 2 RAW files, so you won’t miss a shot.

 
3.0 fps Continuous Shooting


See the Image on a Large LCD with Live View Function.
2.7-inch wide TFT LCD monitor (230,000 dots) with Live View function for improved viewing. 
The EOS Rebel T3 has a huge, bright 2.7-inch TFT (thin film transistor) LCD monitor with 230,000 pixels and a viewing angle of 170°. It’s perfect for Live View composition or viewing camera settings like AF, ISO, Metering, AF Point selection and flash options. And the maximum brightness of the EOS Rebel T3 DSLR’s LCD monitor is about 30% greater than its predecessor, which is a big benefit when you’re using the camera in bright sunlight.

Live View Function
Live View Function enables you to view your subjects directly on the huge 2.7-inch LCD monitor. It’s easy to magnify any part of the scene 5x or 10x for precise manual focus. And now, there are two ways to use Autofocus along with Live View Function in the EOS Rebel T3. You can even choose a grid overlay, perfect for keeping straight lines in your subject straight in your pictures. In the studio, Live View Function can be used remotely via a computer through the EOS Rebel T3 DSLR’s USB connection.




Make Your Images As You See Them.
Express your creativity with ease using advanced imaging features like the new Basic+ function, Quick Setting function and Creative Auto. 
Basic+ is a new creative imaging feature that makes it easy to create the image effects you want. It can be set with the Quick Control screen in Basic Zone modes. Basic+ provides two options:

Shoot by ambience selection:
Based on the Picture Style and its parameters (sharpness, contrast, saturation, and color tone), the exposure compensation and white balance correction are adjusted to attain the selected ambience. You can also select the strength of the ambience effect.

Shoot by lighting or scene type:
Although the actual parameter set is the white balance, the settings are expressed in more understandable terms.

The EOS Rebel T3 DSLR’s Quick Control screen gives you instant access to the most common settings, all in one place! It’s a great way to quickly confirm or change settings while you’re shooting. The Quick Control screen is particularly useful when you’re shooting from a tripod or monopod, with the camera at eye level, because it eliminates the need to view the LCD data panel on top of the camera while changing settings.

For beginners looking to expand their photographic horizons, the EOS Rebel T3 offers Creative Auto mode. While basic settings are based on full automatic operation, shooting guides on the LCD screen enable you to make corrections based on simple to follow guidelines. In essence, with Creative Auto mode, you can learn about photography while taking stunning photographs.


Photography Made Truly Easy.
New Feature Guide offers short descriptions of each function and Quick Control screen for easy operation. 
The Canon EOS Rebel T3 DSLR demystifies great photography by including an in-camera Feature Guide. Appearing on the camera’s LCD, the Feature Guide displays a simple description or advice for the respective function. It is displayed in each shooting mode, during Mode Dial operations, and for Quick Control screen functions (during normal shooting, Live View shooting, movie shooting, and playback). The Feature Guide appears automatically during Mode Dial operations and when a function is selected on the Quick Control screen.


Speedy, Wireless Image Capture and Transmission.
Compatibility with SD/SDHC/SDXC memory cards. 
The EOS Rebel T3 uses popular SD, SDHC and SDXC memory cards. Compact, inexpensive and available in increasingly large capacities, SD, SDHC and SDXC memory cards are a perfect complement to the EOS Rebel T3 DSLR’s compact and lightweight body design.

Additionally, the EOS Rebel T3 is compatible with Eye-Fi* SD cards, which are outfitted with a Wi-Fi transmitter (IEEE 802.11b/g) and internal antenna for wireless, high-speed transfer of images. With an Eye-Fi card installed, the EOS Rebel T3 can display the Eye-Fi’s connection status and error notes with ease, for fully functional wireless uploading of images directly from the camera.

*Canon cameras are not guaranteed to support Eye-Fi card functions, including wireless transfer. In case of an issue with the Eye-Fi card, please consult with the card manufacturer. The use of Eye-Fi cards may not be available outside the United States and Canada; please contact the card manufacturer for territory availability.


Shooting Made Easy 
Compatible with the full line of Canon EF and EF-S lenses. 
EF & EF-S Lenses
The EOS Rebel T3 is compatible with all Canon lenses in the EF and EF-S lineup, ranging from ultra-wide angle to super telephoto lenses. Canon lenses employ advanced optical expertise and micron-precision engineering to deliver unprecedented performance in all facets of the photographic process. Special optical technologies, such as Aspherical, ultra-low dispersion, or fluorite elements are featured in the universally acclaimed L Series lenses, and Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer technology are featured in select lenses to minimize the effect of camera shake. Through Canon lenses, photographers can truly maximize the quality and liberating performance of the EOS Rebel T3. 


What's In The Box 

· EOS Rebel T3 Body

· EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Type II Lens

· Eyecup EF

· Wide Strap EW-200DB

· Interface Cable IFC-130U

· Battery Pack LP-E10

· Battery Charger LC-E10

· EOS Digital Solution Disk and Instruction Manuals “Great photography is Easy “Booklet and “Do More with Macro “Booklet
feature_bullets: Up to 3 frames per second continuous shooting
Eye-fi wireless SD card compatible menu options
Q-menu for access to frequently-used settings

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,089 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
